label: Folder 33: Grice Letter 2
description: Letter to Frederick H. McDonald from Edmund P. Grice  (May 31, 1943) advising him that Lanham Act Funds were received by the Charleston County Public Welfare Board.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value: O. T. WAACE  Senator, Charleston County  Home Address:  Charleston, S. C. The Senate State of South Carolina  COMMITTEES:  Commerce and Manufactures  County Offices and officers  Enroed Acts  Judiciary  Medica Affairs  Miitary  Natura Resources  Charleston, S.C.  June 23, 1943.  Mr. Frederick H.MoDonad, Chairmen  Community development Council  Gibbes Art Gallery  Charleston, S.C.  Re: Survey of status of some basic living necessities in the  Charleston Area.  Dear Mr McDonad-  I have the copy of your letter of June 13th, origina of whioh was addressed to Captain Moses, reative to the above  subject. I certainy thank you for thinking of me, and sending  this important information. It appears from your letter that you had  only a short time to make this survey, but, you certainy have done  it we - and you show a compete and definite knowledge of the facts and conditions.  I certainy hope that a Committee will be formed to handle the various needed suppies and facilities such as that you  mention handing "mik, meat and groceries" You and your Council  have rendered a meritorious service, and one which I hope will bring  real effective resuts.  Your letter shows not only conditions, but, corrective features; your concusions are spendid and correct, and  "hits the nai on the head".  I Sincerely hope that good results will  follow, and that your valued letter will not simpy be fied away.  Yours sincerey,  O.T. WAACE
